Classic Margherita Pizza

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the world of homemade pizza with our Classic Margherita Pizza recipe! This pizza is a timeless favorite that beautifully showcases the simplicity and freshness of its ingredients. With a crispy crust, rich tomato sauce, creamy fresh mozzarella, and aromatic basil, it's no wonder that this dish hails from Naples, Italy, and has become a staple in pizzerias around the globe. In this article, we will guide you through the step-by-step process of creating your very own Margherita pizza right in your kitchen, using just a handful of quality ingredients. Perfect for family dinners, casual gatherings, or a cozy night in, this pizza is sure to impress both pizza enthusiasts and casual eaters alike. So roll up your sleeves, preheat your oven, and get ready to savor the incredible flavors of a classic Margherita pizza!

Ingredients

pizza dough

If you don't have pre-made crust, you can make your own dough using flour, water, yeast, and salt. Alternatively, store-bought dough can be found in the freezer section. For a gluten-free option, look for gluten-free pizza dough.

tomato sauce

Use high-quality canned San Marzano tomatoes for the best flavor. You can also make your own sauce by blending canned tomatoes with garlic, olive oil, and herbs. For a spicy kick, add some crushed red pepper flakes.

fresh mozzarella cheese

Make sure to use fresh mozzarella for a creamy texture. If fresh mozzarella is unavailable, you can substitute with low-moisture mozzarella, but be aware that it has a different taste and texture. Slice the cheese thickly to ensure it melts evenly.

fresh basil leaves

Add fresh basil leaves just before serving to maintain their vibrant color and flavor. If fresh basil is not available, you can use dried basil, but use it sparingly as dried herbs are more concentrated.

olive oil

Use extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor. You can infuse your olive oil with garlic or herbs for added depth. Drizzle a bit more on top after baking for enhanced flavor.

salt

Use kosher salt or sea salt for better flavor distribution. Taste the sauce and cheese before adding salt to avoid over-salting. A sprinkle of flaky sea salt on top before serving can enhance the dish.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Begin by preheating your oven to 475°F (245°C). This high temperature is crucial for achieving that perfect crispy crust. Make sure your oven is fully preheated before placing the pizza inside.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Tomato Sauce

    Take your 1/2 cup of tomato sauce and spread it evenly over the pizza dough using the back of a spoon. If you're feeling adventurous, you can add some herbs or spices to the sauce for extra flavor.

  • Step 3: Add Fresh Mozzarella

    Arrange the 8 oz of sliced fresh mozzarella cheese evenly on top of the sauce. Make sure to leave some space between the slices to allow them to melt and blend together beautifully.

  • Step 4: Drizzle with Olive Oil and Season

    Using a tablespoon, drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil over the mozzarella. This not only adds flavor but also helps the cheese achieve a golden color. Next, sprinkle salt to taste over the pizza.

  • Step 5: Bake the Pizza

    Carefully place the pizza in the preheated oven. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned. Keep an eye on it to avoid burning.

  • Step 6: Finishing Touches

    Once out of the oven, immediately top your hot pizza with the 1/4 cup of fresh basil leaves. The heat will slightly wilt the basil, releasing its aromatic flavor, making it a perfect finishing touch.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to prepare pizza dough?

If using a pre-made crust, simply remove it from the packaging and let it sit at room temperature for about 10-15 minutes before topping. This helps the dough relax and will make it easier to stretch if needed.

How do I know when my pizza is done baking?

Look for a golden-brown crust and bubbly cheese. The pizza should be cooked for about 8-10 minutes at 475°F (245°C), but keep an eye on it, as ovens can vary.

What can I use instead of fresh mozzarella cheese?

You can substitute with shredded mozzarella cheese if fresh is unavailable, but fresh mozzarella will give you a creamier texture and richer flavor.

How much salt should I use?

Start with a pinch of salt when you sprinkle it over the cheese. You can always add more to taste, but it's easier to add than to take away!

What if I don’t have fresh basil?

Dried basil can be a substitute, but use less (about 1 teaspoon) as it is more concentrated. Alternatively, you can leave it out altogether.

Is it safe to use a hot oven?

Yes, just be cautious. Always use oven mitts when handling hot trays and keep an eye on the pizza while it bakes to prevent burning.

What other toppings can I add to my Margherita pizza?

You can add toppings like sliced tomatoes, olives, or a sprinkle of red pepper flakes for some heat. Just remember to keep it light to maintain the classic Margherita flavor.

How should I slice the pizza after it’s cooked?

Use a sharp pizza cutter or a large knife to slice the pizza into wedges. Let it rest for a minute after baking to avoid burning your fingers.

Can I make my own pizza dough?

Absolutely! A simple recipe involves mixing flour, water, yeast, and salt. There are plenty of beginner-friendly recipes online if you want to try it!

What do I do if I burn my pizza?

If the crust is burned but the toppings are okay, you can trim off the burnt edges. Next time, reduce the oven temperature slightly and keep an eye on the pizza as it bakes.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This Margherita pizza can be easily adapted for various dietary preferences. To make it gluten-free, use a gluten-free pizza crust. For a vegan version, substitute the fresh mozzarella with a plant-based cheese alternative or simply omit cheese altogether, allowing the tomato sauce and fresh basil to shine. Ensure that the tomato sauce is free from added sugars or preservatives for a healthier option.

Pairings

For a classic Margherita pizza, pair it with a light-bodied red wine like Chianti or a crisp white wine such as Pinot Grigio. A refreshing Italian lager or a homemade lemonade can also complement the pizza perfectly. For a meatier option, consider serving with prosciutto or a simple arugula salad dressed with lemon and olive oil to balance the flavors.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Margherita pizza hot, directly from the oven, garnished with extra fresh basil leaves for an aromatic touch. For added flavor, offer crushed red pepper flakes or a drizzle of balsamic glaze on the side. Use a pizza stone for an authentic pizzeria-style crust, and consider serving on a wooden pizza peel for a rustic presentation.

Classic Margherita Pizza

25 min
$8
700 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 2

Allergens:

GlutenDairy

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Italian

Course:

Main Dish

Tags:

EasyQuickItalianComfort Food

Description

A simple yet delicious pizza topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, and fragrant basil.

Ingredients

  • pizza dough: 1 pre-made crust
  • tomato sauce: 1/2 cup
  • fresh mozzarella cheese: 8 oz, sliced
  • fresh basil leaves: 1/4 cup
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
